comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110221 Ubuntu/10.10 (maverick) Firefox/3.6.14
Build Identifier: 

In the Join Mozilla on stage.mozilla.org, when providing a fake credit card number, a message appeared at the top of the form "Error processing your contribution. Please correct the problems marked below.". At the Credit card input, the fact that there is an error was pointed by "Credit Card" being of a different color.

Since BSD is able to tell that Credit Card is wrong, all wrong fields could be listed at the top of the form.

Moreover, the functions that check data validity may be able to provide more information on the error. For instance, instead of "the credit card number is wrong", we could imagine messages such as "we were expecting 12 figures, you entered 13".

Overall, the more accurate error messages are, the more likely the user will be willing to fix them and move on.

Reproducible: Always
